summary.text:
**Ensuring proper formatting in JSON**

I need to be careful while using Unicode characters like ℓ in my JSON. It appears that the developer has consistently used ℓ throughout, which makes me think it's probably acceptable. I want to make sure I'm following the same format to maintain consistency. So now, I’ll go ahead and produce the JSON using these characters appropriately. This should help ensure everything is formatted correctly.

content.text: {"summary_md":"Refinements and fixes to the paper's main constructions. A level-dependent threshold schedule t_{k-i}=ℓ^{i+1}+⌈(ℓ^{i+1}−1)/(ℓ−1)⌉ yields S_{k,ℓ}=∑_i t_i = Θ_ℓ(ℓ^k) (no linear-in-k factor); a sharper bound is S_{k,ℓ} ≤ ℓ(ℓ^{k+1}−ℓ)/(ℓ−1)^2 + ((ℓ−2)/(ℓ−1))k. A ray-packing lemma shows one can extract disjoint S^-_{k,ℓ} at all ℓ^k leaves when h ≥ |V(B)| + kℓ|L| + ℓ, giving h ≥ kℓ^{k+1} + (ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1) + ℓ (improving previous bounds). For k=2, counting 2-walks plus a maximum-matching argument yields s ≥ d(d−2ℓ+1)/(d+2ℓ−1) and hence S^-_{2,ℓ} appears when δ^+ > d_*(ℓ)=((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2, fixing a gap in the original proof. Next steps target global selection/packing and better bounds on f(k,h). Citations: papers/paper1.txt","highlights":["Level-dependent thresholds t_{k-i}=ℓ^{i+1}+⌈(ℓ^{i+1}−1)/(ℓ−1)⌉ give S_{k,ℓ}=Θ_ℓ(ℓ^k), eliminating the extra factor k.","Uniform-threshold T*=⌈ℓ^k·ℓ/(ℓ−1)⌉ works but is weaker (cost kT*).","Ray-packing: disjoint S^-_{k,ℓ} at all ℓ^k leaves possible when h ≥ |V(B)|+kℓ|L|+ℓ; with |V(B)|=(ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1) this yields h ≥ kℓ^{k+1}+(ℓ^{k+1}−1)/(ℓ−1)+ℓ.","Corollary: δ^+(G) ≥ f(k,h)+S_{k,ℓ} suffices to embed T(k,ℓ) with improved constants.","k=2 correction: 2-walk counts + max matching give s ≥ d(d−2ℓ+1)/(d+2ℓ−1), so δ^+ > ((3ℓ−1)+√(17ℓ^2−10ℓ+1))/2; fixes a flawed maximality step. "],"next_questions":["Globalize the child-selection step (matching/nibble) to push S_{k,ℓ} to (1+o(1))·C(ℓ)·ℓ^k.","Globalize ray-packing to reduce h toward (1+o(1))·kℓ^{k+1}.","Obtain substantially better bounds on f(k,h) (ideally polynomial in h for fixed k) to turn structural improvements into much smaller δ^+ thresholds."]}
